info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 17 at 12:52PM EST until December 17 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Berkeley County in southeastern South Carolina... Charleston County in southeastern South Carolina... Colleton County in southeastern South Carolina... * Until 300 PM EST. * At 1247 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated a line of intense rainfall moving up the Charleston County coast. The risk for flash flooding continues for area around Awendaw and McClellanville where an additional 1 to 3 inches of rain could fall through 3 PM. Elsewhere across Charleston County, including Downtown Charleston as well as Edisto Beach and Daniel Island, the heaviest rains have shifted east of those locations. No additional flash flooding is expected. However, many areas remain flooded due to a combination of high tides and rainfall of 4 to 6 inches. It will take several hours for flood waters to recede. THIS IS A DANGEROUS SITUATION. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Goose Creek, Hanahan, McClellanville, Edisto Beach, Downtown Charleston, Daniel Island, Fort Sumter, James Island, I-26/I-526 Interchange, West Ashley, Johns Island, Hollywood, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Ravenel, Sullivan`s Island, Seabrook Island and Kiawah Island. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
